channel.title: What Pisses Me Off on Mopar
channel.description:
Okay, So Here's What Gets To Me. Everytime Something Useful That Isn't Fully Explained Gets Posted in Tutorials, It's Removed. Theres Always The Forum Brat Saying "TROLOL THIS IS A SNIPPET!!!". Why? Nobody Ever Checks The Snippets and Nobody Cares To. They Want An Actual Thread Where They Can View People's Comments on The Threads ETC. So Why Forums People, Do You Troll The Snippet Tutorials? Because They're Not an Actual Tutorial?
TUTORIAL Something that provides special, often individual instruction, especially: a. A book or class that provides instruction in a particular area. b. Computer Science A program that provides instruction for the use of a system or of software.
The Snippet is "Information" Given To A Person So They Can Do Something For Their Server. Why Would That Not Be a Tutorial?

item.title: What Pisses Me Off on Mopar
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

It gets technical, here on mopar, a snippet is a small bit of code, which can’t be explained all that well, since it’s so small.
a tutorial is a rather large bit of code, with careful explanation, and good documentation.

Somethings acceptable as tutorials would be, if matching the description above, a combat system, how to complete certain tasks using certain implementations, etcetera. A skill or something is more of a snippet because you’re not teaching somebody how to do something, just telling him to copy and paste your code, he really isn’t learning anything from your tutorial.

Don’t put a command that’s “well explained” in the tutorials section. Oh, and OP, quit being a faggot.

Read full topic
item.source: What Pisses Me Off on Mopar

item.title: What Pisses Me Off on Mopar
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:6, topic:463512”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=566999.msg4121043#msg4121043 date=1349729331]
On mopar by definition

a tutorial is something that is explained line for line for the newbies. It must have particular instructions and must teach in the process. That is a tutorial.

A snippet is a part of instruction but it does not follow any type of leading information. Such as where to add, why you do this type of code instead of another, etc.
[/quote]
this ^

Also when snippets was still a topic barely anyone looked but now we have a subsection for it so I’m pretty sure people go look there.
It’s not that hard to click an extra time…[/quote]omg rep++ - o wait…

Read full topic
item.source: What Pisses Me Off on Mopar

It’s not that hard to click an extra time…

item.title: What Pisses Me Off on Mopar
item.dc:creator: @heatrn11 heatrn11
item.description:
@heatrn11 wrote:

[quote=“Ashley, post:2, topic:463512”]Nowadays the internet is full of kids that love to ‘troll’ others and mess around. They know they get away with it easily so they will just continue to do it over and over till they finally get bored and realize how pathetic they look… There’s just no getting away from it.

The removal of topics could be caused by it already been released many times before, or is just common sense for a server.[/quote]
Ahhhh…This is the truth.
